com.magnet.android.mms.connection

Class ConnectionConfigManager.ConnectionConfig

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.magnet.android.mms.connection.ConnectionConfigManager.ConnectionConfig
  • Enclosing class:
    ConnectionConfigManager

    public static final class ConnectionConfigManager.ConnectionConfig
extends Object
    Represents a connection endpoint. Each endpoint has an arbitrary name, a URI, and an authentication/authorization handler.

    • Method Detail

      • getName

        public String getName()
        Retrieves the name associated with this connection configuration. This name is the same one used to reference this connection when performing endpoint-specific lookups.
        Returns:
        The name associated with this connection configuration.

      • getAuthHandlerClass

        public Class<? extends ConnectionConfigManager.AuthHandler> getAuthHandlerClass()
        Retrieves the AuthHandler implementation class for this connection configuration. Custom AuthHandler implementations can be created as necessary. By default, the SDK includes a MagnetRestAuthHandler to handle the the authentication challenge and Magnet OAuth request (for third party services).
        Returns:
        The AuthHandler implementation class for this connection configuration.

      • getRealm

        public String getRealm()
        Retrieves the authentication realm for this configuration.
        Returns:
        The authentication realm for this configuration.

      • equals

        public boolean equals(Object other)
        Overrides:
        equals in class Object

      • setToken

        public void setToken(ConnectionConfigManager.AuthHandler.TokenType tokenType,
            String tokenValue,
            boolean isPersistent)
        Sets the specified token type and token value for this connection configuration. Setting with a value of null removes the token. The isPersistent flag will store the token value to be used when the application is restarted; otherwise, when the application process dies, the token is discarded. NOTE: Tokens are specified on a per-realm basis. If multiple configurations share the same realm, they will share the token.
        Parameters:
        tokenType - The token type for this connection configuration (username, password, OAuth token).
        tokenValue - The token value for this connection configuration.
        isPersistent - Set to true to store the token for subsequent application restarts; set to false otherwise.

      • getToken

        public String getToken(ConnectionConfigManager.AuthHandler.TokenType tokenType)
        Retrieves the specified token type for this connection configuration. As described in the setToken(ConnectionConfigManager.AuthHandler.TokenType, String, boolean) method, the tokens are stored per-realm. If another configuration shares the same realm, this method will return the value as previously defined.
        Parameters:
        tokenType - The token type for this connection configuration (username, password, OAuth token).
        Returns:
        The specified token type for this connection configuration.

      • getConnectionService

        public ConnectionService getConnectionService()
        Retrieves the connection service for this connection configuration.
        Returns:
        The connection service for this connection configuration.
